John Deere - Ana.title: John Deere - Ana
John Deere - Ana.summary: Augmented Reality experience with John Deere's virtual assistant
description:
This project is an augmented reality experience for the launch of John Deere's virtual assistant.

The experience consists of a web application that allowed users to interact with John Deere's virtual assistant, Ana, in an augmented reality environment.

The app was developed with Three.JS and Javascript's WebXR API.

It was a very interesting project, and it led me to research a lot about the API and the inner workings of WebXR and the web browser (I ended up reading Chromium's source code ðŸ˜¬).

I even wrote a couple of articles about problems that came up in this project. You can read them in my Medium profile.
responsibilities: Design and development of the web application (Three.JS)
Research and development of the augmented reality experience (WebXR)

Wiz Light Manager.title: Wiz Lights Manager
Wiz Light Manager.summary: Typescript library and Electron application to manage Wiz smart lights.
description:
Wiz Light Manager is a Typescript library and an Electron application to manage Wiz smart lights through a UDP API that each light hosts.

It's a project that I started in Rust, but due to my lack of experience in Rust, I decided to change to Typescript.

The Typescript library is an API to interact with Wiz lights.
It allows you to discover lights in the local network, change their color, brightness, color temperature, etc.

The Electron application is a graphical interface for the library.

It was a project that arose from a personal need and ended up being a very interesting and useful project.
responsibilities: Design and development of a Typescript library
Design and development of an Electron application

Solucionadores.title: WD-40 Club de Solucionadores
Solucionadores.summary: Social media platform / community blog, developed in Next.JS for WD-40 LATAM.
description:
Social media platform / community blog where people can share their experiences and tips using WD-40 products.

Building this was an interesting experience. The whole team jumped head first into an ambicious project with new technologies and tight deadlines.

It came out as a great project and learning experience.

SistemaAenima.title: SistemaAenima
SistemaAenima.summary: Remaking of internal budget management system's front end and backend complete refactor and improvements.
description:
This project was a remaking of an internal budget management system's front end and the improvements on the backend.

The original system was made in AngularJS and was very slow and hard to maintain. On top of that, half of it was not even working properly.

The new one was made in React and was a great learning experience. It was also a great opportunity to improve its functionality and user experience.

The backend and database also needed some reworking and added functionality.


Obviously, this being an internal system, I can only talk about my experience developing it and can't provide much information about it.

GameOfLife.title: â¬¢â¬¡ Game of Life â¬¡â¬¢
GameOfLife.summary: Conway's Game of Life implementation in Typescript and p5.js. With hexagons â¬¡â¬¢!
description:
Conway's Game of Life implementation in Typescript and p5.js.

I decided to make it with hexagons instead of squares because I thought it was more visually interesting.
Also because I had already made an implementation with squares in the past.

It was a fun project and it allowed me to learn about hexagonal coordinates and how to implement a game of life with them.

Rollies.title: Rollies | Roll your dice
Rollies.summary: A dice roller syntax parser and site made in Typescript.
description:
A dice roller built from the ground up in Typescript.
Based on the DiceParser syntax and the Write An Interpreter In Go book by Thorsten Ball.

Building a lexer, parser and evaluator from scratch was something I wanted to do for a long time.
I knew the theory behind it, but I had never implemented it myself.

It was a great learning experience and a fun project to make.

PixelChat.title: PixelChat
PixelChat.summary: Live public chat and drawing with pixels along with other people!.
description:
A personal project that I developed with Vanilla JS and SockeIO for learning about websockets.

I started with a livechat because it's the classic example for a first project with websockets.
But I quickly found that making only a chat was kind of boring so I thought of making something more interesting.

I came up with the idea of drawing with other people.
I had previously made a Discord bot that allowed users to draw with pixels in a 25x25 canvas, so I decided to add the same idea in here

I think it came out as a great project and final product.

EzReachFlexitapa.title: EZ-Reach & Flexitapa
EzReachFlexitapa.summary: Minigames developed with P5.JS for sampling campaign with discounts as rewards for WD-40 products.
description:
This project was an ad campaign for WD-40 products where people can play a minigame and get a discount as reward.

The games were developed by me with P5.JS and the landing pages surrounding them were made with React by a team partner.
These games were finally used in a live expo in a WD-40 stand in the form of PWA. A contest was organized for even more prices for the attendees.

This was a fun and different project. Not often do you get the chance to work on videogames in the web development industry.

CanvasASCII.title: Canvas ASCII
CanvasASCII.summary: An image manipulation tool that converts images to ASCII art. Made with HTML5 canvas.
description:
A simple ASCII art generator from images made with HTML5 Canvas.

It also allows you to manipulate other aspects of the image like brightness, pixel size, color depth, etc.

I made this project for learning about HTML5 Canvas and how to use it to make simple image processing.

It was a fun project and I learned a lot about Canvas and image processing.

SvelteQ&A.title: Svelte Q&A
SvelteQ&A.summary: A quick and simple Q&A app made with SvelteKit, Planetscale, Prisma and deployed in Vercel.
description:
Simple anonymous questions and answers app made for getting familiar with SvelteKit.

It was a quick and dirty project that I made in a few hours. It's not the best code I've ever written, but it was a great way to do something in a framework I was not familiar with.
I also used this project to get familiar with Planetscale, Prisma.

All of these are great technologies that allowed me to make this project in a very short time and in a very stable and reliable way.

Formlic.title: Formlic
Formlic.summary: An open-source "form as a service" platform for creating and managing forms endpoints for web applications.
description:
A project I started because I didn't like the way most form services work.
I wanted to create a service that was easy to use, had a good UI and was open-source.

You can create a form, get a link to it and send POST requests to it to save the data and email it to you.

I started this project with the idea of making it production ready, at least for my own use cases
responsibilities: Database structure design and implementation (MongoDB + Prisma)

IntegralsCheatsheet.title: Integrals Cheatsheet
IntegralsCheatsheet.summary: A printable list of commonly used integrals with Wolfram Alpha integration. Made for learning Astro.
description: This project was made mainly for learning Astro and how to use it for lightweight, fast and easy to make statically generated sites.
Made while I was studying for my Calculus III exam. It was a great way to learn Astro and it's features.
